meanings.definition: Carry out or put into effect (a plan, order, or course of action)
meanings.sent1: She executes her plan with precision.
meanings.sent2: The team executes the project successfully.
meanings.sent3: He executes his plan like a skilled conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent4: The artist executes each brushstroke with purpose.
meanings.sent5: The chef executes the recipe flawlessly, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Perform or accomplish (a task or duty)
meanings.sent2: The athlete executes the perfect dive.
meanings.sent3: The robot executes its tasks with robotic precision.
meanings.sent4: She executes her role in the play with grace.
meanings.sent5: The student executes the experiment, following each step carefully.

meanings.definition: Put to death as a legal penalty
meanings.sent1: The criminal was executed for his crimes.
meanings.sent2: The king ordered to execute the traitor.
meanings.sent3: The movie villain always wants to execute his enemies in a dramatic way.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to execute the flowers in the garden with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The judge decided to execute the sentence, bringing closure to the case.
